reviews.review: o jogo e muito bom com um multiplayer muito divertido adoro jogar ele com meus amigos

Unless you want the original un-modded experience, just play L4D2 instead. I find this game to be pretty bland without mods. 
Maybe play this first if you're just into zombies and survival games but stay away if you don't want a modded experience or a community-made experience.  Overall it's pretty much the exact same game without the mods.

Más de una década después de su lanzamiento, sigue siendo el shooter cooperativo más endemoniadamente divertido que te puedas encontrar. Por muchos años que hayan pasado, aún resulta una gozada juntarse con 3 amigos más y echarse unas buenas partidas al Left4Dead y su secuela.
The game is off the charts, I get a real pleasure, I would like more weapons, but it will do just that, I always dreamed of killing zombies and feeling for real.

Das Spiel ist zwar schon etwas älter aber es macht trotzdem verdammt Laune. Es ist einfach genau mein Ding einfach nur rum Ballern . Zur Abwechslung ist es einfach genau das richtige und zum Kopf frei kriegen. Ich Empfehle das Spiel  weiter und genau zu Halloween genau das richtige. 
Tatsächlich gibt es auch noch viele Leute die das Game rein suchten und das ist natürlich geil! :D

Left 4 Dead is a bit on the dated side but even 10+ years later the game is an absolute blast with friends in co-op.

While having a lot of down time during COVID I have been doing my best to get through my backlog of games and Left 4 Dead was on that list. After beating the campaign solo a few times I realized that the dated graphics and lack of quality of life improvements from L4D 2 was really taxing me so I decided to try co-op with some public groups that were running and that is when the game changed for me. I realized the graphics didn't matter to me as much as the laughs and craziness that was happening all around me.

I will definitely give Left 4 Dead a thumbs up but if you are playing this game any time after 2020 I would recommend going into this with a group of friends!

runs on a barebones and slightly updated orange box rendition of source, feature-complete with fast loading times and more graphical limitations than its sequel.
thanks to valve shelving this after l4d2, this is more or less a time capsule much like console renditions of valve games; no updates roughly a year after release, an old voice codec, and a mountain of fuzzy, warming nostalgia (or the childhood you couldn't get properly).

funnily enough, this game feels more complete than l4d2 despite being birthed out of some employees messing around with counter-strike source - that last part also explains why the story is so ambiguous in this game (l4d2 and the comics elaborate on things kinda, but alone? l4d1's story is almost entirely environmental)

also these survivors are better than the l4d2 ones (and leagues ahead of b4b on account of them trying too hard)

Very good. My first shooter game and I really liked it.

No bugs.   Smooth play.  Good AI.   Played online and made some friends.  Coop is great if you find serious teammates.   The graphics are a little dated, but it works and older computers will be able to play it.
